long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Despite the upstream commit [1] and the update of spec file [2] the check is still pulled in:
$ dnf repoquery --requires libdmapsharing | grep check libcheck.so.0 libcheck.so.0()(64bit)
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): $ dnf repoquery libdmapsharing libdmapsharing-0:2.9.29-2.fc22.x86_64
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. 2. 3.
Actual results: $ dnf repoquery --requires libdmapsharing | grep check libcheck.so.0 libcheck.so.0()(64bit)
Expected results: $ dnf repoquery --requires libdmapsharing | grep check
Additional info:
[1] https://git.gnome.org/browse/libdmapsharing/commit/?id=1f6ae2a6d01fac70106ddac862c64b3cec0717ef [2] http://pkgs.fedoraproject.org/cgit/libdmapsharing.git/commit/?id=0509c5d4d894e171c4aa625c7fbce9a8045a42e9

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 22 development cycle. Changing version to '22'.
More information and reason for this action is here: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_Program_Management/HouseKeeping/Fedora22
Ping? This is still issue for libdmapsharing-2.9.30-2.fc23

Fedora 22 changed to end-of-life (EOL) status on 2016-07-19. Fedora 22 is no longer maintained, which means that it will not receive any further security or bug fix updates. As a result we are closing this bug.
If you can reproduce this bug against a currently maintained version of Fedora please feel free to reopen this bug against that version. If you are unable to reopen this bug, please file a new report against the current release. If you experience problems, please add a comment to this bug.
Thank you for reporting this bug and we are sorry it could not be fixed.

Gstreamer1-plugins-base-devel requires check-devel, and libdmapsharing requires gstreamer1-plugins-base-devel to build. Libdmapsharing builds against check when check-devel is installed. Libdmapsharing probably needs a configure-script option to explicitly disable check support.
libdmapsharing-2.9.36-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-b8e853401e
I installed the latest version from Koji and were able to remove check from my system. Thanks for fixing this.

libdmapsharing-2.9.36-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-b8e853401e
libdmapsharing-2.9.36-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
libdmapsharing-2.9.36-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-2dcf700de2

libdmapsharing-2.9.36-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-2dcf700de2
libdmapsharing-2.9.36-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
